Title: Greece-Bulgaria IGB gas pipeline capacity to rise as Alexandroupolis LNG terminal starts
Description: The capacity of the Greece-Bulgaria gas interconnector IGB should expand in synchronisation with the commissioning of Greece’s Alexandroupolis LNG terminal in 2024. The pipeline is central to Bulgaria’s security and diversity of supplies as it gives it greater access to global LNG.
Author: DE

Title: Norway’s Equinor invests to boost gas production
Description: Norwegian producer Equinor will invest in infrastructure upgrades to boost gas production. The firm has been trying to boost exports to Europe, its main export market, which is currently facing a severe gas shortage as it pivots away from Russian gas.
Author: DE

Title: Freeport LNG pushes back plant restart by two weeks to end-December
Description: Plant operator Freeport LNG has delayed the restart of its shuttered 15 mtpa plant on Quintana Island in Texas by a further two weeks to the end of this month, having secured key regulatory approvals only yesterday that allow it to complete critical repairs.
Author: CK

Title: China’s year-on-year LNG receipts fall in November; Russia, Qatar imports buck the trend
Description: China’s usual LNG suppliers Australia, Qatar and the US shipped more LNG to the country in November, with overall receipts for the month rising sharply after staying fairly flat since February. But, the November imports were lower than year-earlier levels as high LNG spot prices and increased domestic gas output continued to curb incremental spot LNG demand.
Author: CK
